46 // Class definitions
48 // See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36246300/parallel-loops-in-c/36246386
61 
62 class ParallelLoopGenerator {
63 public:
64  ParallelLoopGenerator(ThreadPool* pool = nullptr, bool use_threads = true) :
65  m_useThreads(use_threads),
66  m_pool(pool)
67  {
68  }
69 
70  void parallelFor(unsigned num_elements, std::function<void(int start, int end)> functor)
71  {
72  unsigned num_threads;
73 
74  if (!m_pool) {
75  // Use hardware to determine number of threads
76  unsigned num_threads_hint = std::thread::hardware_concurrency();
77  num_threads = num_threads_hint == 0 ? 8 : (num_threads_hint);
78  }
79  else {
80  // Use number of threads in pool
81  num_threads = m_pool->maxThreadCount();
82  }
83 
84  unsigned batch_size = num_elements / num_threads;
85  unsigned batch_remainder = num_elements % num_threads;
86 
87  std::vector<std::thread> my_threads;
88  std::vector<std::future<void>> results;
89  if (m_useThreads)
90  {
91  // Multithread execution
92  if (m_pool) {
93  // Use threads from threadpool (much faster if limited by overhead of thread creation)
94  for (unsigned i = 0; i < num_threads; ++i)
95  {
96  int start = i * batch_size;
97  //auto result = m_pool->enqueue(functor, start, start + batch_size);
98  results.push_back(m_pool->addTask(functor, start, start + batch_size));
99  //result.get();
100  }
101  }
102  else {
103  // Generate threads on the fly
104  my_threads.resize(num_threads);
105  for (unsigned i = 0; i < num_threads; ++i)
106  {
107  int start = i * batch_size;
108  my_threads[i] = std::thread(functor, start, start + batch_size);
109  }
110  }
111  }
112  else
113  {
114  // Single thread execution (for easy debugging)
115  for (unsigned i = 0; i < num_threads; ++i) {
116  int start = i * batch_size;
117  functor(start, start + batch_size);
118  }
119  }
120 
121  // Deform the elements left
122  if (batch_remainder != 0) {
123  int start = num_threads * batch_size;
124  functor(start, start + batch_remainder);
125  }
126 
127  // Wait for the other thread to finish their task
128  if (m_useThreads) {
129  if (!m_pool) {
130  std::for_each(my_threads.begin(), my_threads.end(), std::mem_fn(&std::thread::join));
131  }
132  else {
133 // while (m_pool->hasTasks()) {
134 // // Wait until all tasks have completed
135 //#ifdef DEBUG_MODE
136 // qDebug() << "ThreadPool: Waiting for task completion";
137 //#endif
138 // }
139  for (std::future<void>& result : results) {
140  result.get();
141  }
142  }
143  }
144  }
145 
146 private:
147  bool m_useThreads;
148  ThreadPool* m_pool;
149 };
150 
151 
153 } // End namespaces
154 
155 #endif

rev::ThreadPool::addTask
auto addTask(F &&f, Args &&... args) -> std::future< typename std::invoke_result_t< F, Args... >>
Add a job to the pool's task queue.
